layout_template.notes: Layout based on the Africa_ADayInTheLife.jpg draft (layout reference only; character content populated from new_prompts.xlsx + Antarctica.docx).

header.notes: Handwritten/script title at top-left over a muted world-map background.

grid.notes: Each character row = left info panel + 6 image cards. Each card has a square photo above a short caption.

characters.name: Kiri

label.headline: Kiri
label.subhead: A Sled Dog at an Antarctic Outpost
label.notes: Left-side info panel: small flag icon above the character name; subhead directly below.

characters.bio_short: Kiri is a sled dog living at an Antarctic research outpost in the midâ€‘20th century, working with handlers and a team of dogs to haul supplies across snowfields and sea ice.

scenes.sequence_notes: Scene 1 starts the day; scenes progress in chronological order.
scenes.caption_first_person: I stretch in straw, sniff icy air, and listen for my handlerâ€™s crunching boots.

research_context.visual_description: The sky is still dark, with a faint bluish glow on the horizon. Wooden kennels line a snowy clearing near a small research hut. Kiri, a sturdy sled dog with thick, frost-tipped fur and a leather collar, stands at the entrance of his kennel. Surrounding him are other dogs, some curled up, others yawning. A handlerâ€™s silhouette is visible in the distance, lantern in hand. You can see Kiriâ€™s breath in the cold air, and a line of sleds half-buried in snow behind him.
research_context.what_happening: Itâ€™s early morning in Antarctica, and the research station is quiet except for the soft whimpers of sled dogs waking up. Kiri is stretching and sniffing the air, aware that the humans will soon come with food. He senses their mood even before they arrive, noticing how they move more carefully in the dim light. The calm before the dayâ€™s journey sets a patient, expectant tone.
research_context.accompanying_text: Kiri wakes up in the dark morning air. He sniffs the snow and watches for the humans who bring food. Soon, he will run across the ice with his team.

scenes.sequence_notes: Scene 1 starts the day; scenes progress in chronological order.
scenes.caption_first_person: Buckles tighten on my fur; a soft pat tells me it is time to run.

research_context.visual_description: Pale morning light now reveals a broad expanse of ice and snow. Kiri and several other dogs stand in a line, each harnessed to a sled. Metal runners gleam, and leather harness straps contrast with the white surroundings. Two humans in heavy parkas kneel, adjusting buckles and speaking softly to the dogs. A few fuel drums and supply crates stand stacked nearby, indicating an expedition about to depart.
research_context.what_happening: Kiri feels the humansâ€™ hands on his harness, checking everything twice. The sled is loaded with gear: food, tools, and scientific instruments. The dogs stomp the snow, eager to move. Quiet words between the handlers suggest careful planning: theyâ€™re heading out to place supplies at a distant depot or survey the landscape. Kiri can tell itâ€™s an important runâ€”he senses their tension and excitement.
research_context.accompanying_text: Kiri stands still as the humans fit his harness. He can feel their careful hands and gentle words. Soon, he will pull the sled across the snowy land.

scenes.sequence_notes: Scene 1 starts the day; scenes progress in chronological order.
scenes.caption_first_person: Wind whistles past my ears; I lead the pack, tracks streaking behind like ribbon.

research_context.visual_description: The sled team glides across an open plain of endless white, under a sky washed with pale light. Kiri, front and center, leads the dog line. Snow sprays under their paws. In the background, low hills and distant mountains break the horizon. The humans stand behind the sled, leaning forward, their breath visible. Tracks stretch behind them, the only sign of life in this frozen world.
research_context.what_happening: The dogs are in motion, pulling smoothly over hard-packed snow. Kiriâ€™s senses are sharp: the crunch of ice, the creak of the sled, the quiet words exchanged behind him. He notices flags planted in the ice, likely route markers. The humans trust the dogsâ€™ strength and rhythm. Everything feels purposeful, as if each pawstep brings the team closer to their goal.
research_context.accompanying_text: Kiri runs with his pack, pulling the sled through silent snow. The world feels huge and empty, but he is strong, and the humans follow his lead.

research_context.visual_description: The sled team has stopped near a low ridge of ice. Humans crouch by a small stove, steam rising as they melt snow for a hot drink. Kiri and the other dogs stand or lie down, their breath forming clouds. One human offers a piece of pemmican to a dog, while another checks a map spread on a crate. The light is brighter now, revealing subtle blues and purples in the ice.
research_context.what_happening: A brief rest: humans refuel with warm beverages, sharing quiet conversation about their position and the weather. Kiri rests too, ears perked, hoping for a treat. He notes the humansâ€™ relaxed tonesâ€”things are going as planned. The stillness highlights how important these breaks are for morale and energy.
research_context.accompanying_text: Kiri stands still while the humans sip hot drinks. He tastes a bit of food and feels happy. Soon, they will keep moving.

scenes.sequence_notes: Scene 1 starts the day; scenes progress in chronological order.
scenes.caption_first_person: I spot home and pull harderâ€”warm smells and friendly pats are almost here.

research_context.visual_description: The station buildings come into view: small huts and antennae rising from a white desert. The sled glides downhill, dogs trotting steadily. The sun is low, casting long shadows, turning ice into a pastel landscape. A few humans outside the station wave as the team approaches, equipment rattling softly.
research_context.what_happening: Kiri senses relief in the humansâ€”the dayâ€™s objective must have been met. They covered ground, placed supplies, or gathered data. Now they return, tired but satisfied. Kiri feels proud, tail up, knowing he helped. The approaching station means warmth, rest, and familiar scents.
research_context.accompanying_text: Kiri sees the huts and knows home is near. The humans seem glad. He has done his job well.

scenes.caption_first_person: I nestle down, muscles tired but happy, dreaming of tomorrowâ€™s snowy trail.

research_context.visual_description: Inside a makeshift kennel shelter, lamplight glows. Snow piles against wooden walls. Kiri curls in straw bedding, other dogs settling in. Outside, the Antarctic wind hums. A human looks in, smiling and dropping a chunk of dried fish. The air is warmer here, safe and calm.
research_context.what_happening: The work done, the team rests. Kiri relaxes, muscles tired, belly full. He hears distant laughter, maybe some celebration among the humans. He ponders their strange ways and equipment, but appreciates their kindness and purpose. The pack sleeps soundly, bonded by shared effort.
research_context.accompanying_text: Kiri rests in his straw bed. Outside, the wind blows, but inside it is safe. He closes his eyes, dreaming of tomorrowâ€™s run.

characters.bio_short: Harold Fletcher is a Heroicâ€‘Age Antarctic explorer, balancing navigation, weather observations, and camp survival tasks in the era of early polar expeditions.

scenes.sequence_notes: Scene 1 starts the day; scenes progress in chronological order.
scenes.caption_first_person: I jot the icy wind in my log, boots crunching in the half-dark.

research_context.visual_description: A canvas tent on the Antarctic plateau, lit faintly by a lantern inside. Harold stands outside, bundled in thick wool layers, goggles on his forehead. Snow drifts gently. Sledges and supplies are partially buried in snow nearby. The sky glows faintly, hinting at sunrise, but still mostly dark.
research_context.what_happening: Harold checks a thermometer and wind vane, recording weather data in a small notebook. The rest of the team sleeps inside the tent. Heâ€™s thinking about the dayâ€™s routeâ€”navigating crevasses and collecting geological samples. The silence is complete, except for the crunch of his boots.
research_context.accompanying_text: Harold stands in the cold morning dim. He notes the wind and temperature in his book. Today will be another step toward discovery.

scenes.sequence_notes: Scene 1 starts the day; scenes progress in chronological order.
scenes.caption_first_person: Cocoa warms my hands as we whisper plans; the wide ice waits.

research_context.visual_description: Inside a canvas tent, a small primus stove flickers. Three men, including Harold, sit on crates, steaming tin mugs in hand. Biscuits and pemmican lay on a cloth. Frost clings to tent ropes. Their breath is visible in lamplight.
research_context.what_happening: The team shares a simple meal. They discuss the planned route across the ice shelf. Harold listens as the leader reviews map sketches. Everyoneâ€™s faces show determination and camaraderie. This quiet ritual fuels their bodies and spirits.
research_context.accompanying_text: Harold sips hot cocoa and shares dry biscuits. The men talk quietly, planning their long march. Soon, they will face the wide, white land again.

characters.bio_short: Dr. Miriam Lee is a contemporary iceâ€‘core scientist stationed in Antarctica, drilling and analyzing cores to reconstruct past climates and improve longâ€‘range climate understanding.

Miriam, wearing a light-blue insulated jacket, checks a drill bit and calibrates sensors on a portable device. Through a window, a bright Antarctic summer sky and snowfields shine.
research_context.what_happening: Miriam prepares her ice coring equipment, reviewing data and ensuring tools are in top shape. Digital screens show charts, and notes from global collaborators scroll by. Sheâ€™s aware that each core sample can reveal centuries of climate history.
research_context.accompanying_text: Miriam checks her tools and reads the morning data. Today, she will drill into the ice to learn about Earthâ€™s past weather.

research_context.accompanying_text: Miriamâ€™s drill hums softly. She pulls up a long ice core, layer by layer. This frozen record holds secrets of our Earthâ€™s past.

scenes.caption_first_person: Orange light bathes the snow as I promise to uncover older stories buried below.

image.alt_text: Dr. Miriam Lee: Outside station at golden hour (Antarctica).

research_context.visual_description: Standing outside near the station, Miriam gazes at a sun low on the horizon but still shining due to polar summer. The snow glows in soft pastel colors. She wears protective sunglasses, arms crossed contentedly. Sleds, weather instruments, and a few antenna masts dot the landscape.
research_context.what_happening: The dayâ€™s work done, Miriam reflects on the ice core samples and data sent abroad. She understands this placeâ€™s fragile beauty and importance to global climate studies. Tomorrow, sheâ€™ll drill deeper, unveiling older chapters of Earthâ€™s story.
research_context.accompanying_text: Miriam stands under a never-setting sun. She thinks about what the ice has shown her today. The answers in the ice may help everyone on Earth.
